title: **HELP** Error("Could not find artifacts for " + import_path + " from any sources")
body:
So Basically I'm new in Web3 Development, this is supposed to be my first project, sorry if its silly.

So this is the Contract, saved in the contracts folder as **firstContract.sol**
```
// SPDX-License-Identifier: GPL-3.0

pragma solidity >=0.4.22 <0.9.0;

contract HelloBlockchain {
    
    function sayHi() public pure returns (string memory) {
        return "!Hello, blockchain!";
    }

}
```
SO Yeah, pretty Basic...
The **firstContract.js** File in the migrations folder is

```
var helloBlockchain = artifacts.require("./contracts/firstContract.sol");

module.exports = function (deployer) {
	deployer.deploy(helloBlockchain)
}
```

And the outpur/error I'm having when using the command -> 
>truffle(development)> migrate

```
Compiling your contracts...
===========================
> Everything is up to date, there is nothing to compile.



Starting migrations...
======================
> Network name:    'development'
> Network id:      1642129526530
> Block gas limit: 6721975 (0x6691b7)


2_firstContract.js
==================

/usr/local/lib/node_modules/truffle/build/459.bundled.js:27188
        throw new Error("Could not find artifacts for " + import_path + " from any sources");
        ^

Error: Could not find artifacts for contracts/firstContract from any sources
    at Resolver.require (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/truffle/build/webpack:/packages/resolver/dist/lib/resolver.js:60:1)
    at Object.require (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/truffle/build/webpack:/packages/migrate/index.js:172:1)
    at ResolverIntercept.require (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/truffle/build/webpack:/packages/migrate/ResolverIntercept.js:22:1)
    at /home/sashanclrp/Platzi/web3/preworkAppsBlockchain/firstSmartContract/migrations/2_firstContract.js:1:33
    at Script.runInContext (node:vm:139:12)
    at Script.runInNewContext (node:vm:144:17)
    at Object.file (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/truffle/build/webpack:/packages/require/require.js:94:1)
    at Migration._load (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/truffle/build/webpack:/packages/migrate/Migration.js:44:1)
    at processTicksAndRejections (node:internal/process/task_queues:96:5)
    at Migration.run (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/truffle/build/webpack:/packages/migrate/Migration.js:217:1)
    at Object.runMigrations (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/truffle/build/webpack:/packages/migrate/index.js:150:1)
    at Object.runFrom (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/truffle/build/webpack:/packages/migrate/index.js:110:1)
    at Object.run (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/truffle/build/webpack:/packages/migrate/index.js:87:1)
    at runMigrations (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/truffle/build/webpack:/packages/core/lib/commands/migrate/run.js:76:1)

Error: Could not find artifacts for contracts/firstContract from any sources
    at Resolver.require (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/truffle/build/webpack:/packages/resolver/dist/lib/resolver.js:60:1)

    at Migration.run (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/truffle/build/webpack:/packages/migrate/Migration.js:217:1)
    at Object.runMigrations (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/truffle/build/webpack:/packages/migrate/index.js:150:1)
    at Object.runFrom (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/truffle/build/webpack:/packages/migrate/index.js:110:1)
    at Object.run (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/truffle/build/webpack:/packages/migrate/index.js:87:1)
    at runMigrations (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/truffle/build/webpack:/packages/core/lib/commands/migrate/run.js:76:1)
    at Object.module.exports [as run] (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/truffle/build/webpack:/packages/core/lib/commands/migrate/run.js:44:1)

```

Can Anyone guide me on how to solve this? Thanks!

So basically I fix it my self -> 
The problem is that the file.sol and the file.js that calls the contract in the migration folder can't be named the same, it does'nt matter the extension itself.
This is weird, I really don't understand why, if anyone can explain me why would be wonderful. 

Anyways,
So, basically all I did was changing the migration file associated with the contract from firstContract.js to first_contract.js and that did the trick!

Hope this helps! 

I Still want an answer regarding why this happens, so thank you in advanced to anyone willing to explain me.

The actual problem is that you're supplying the wrong argument to `artifacts.require`; it takes the name of the contract, not the name of the file; i.e., you should do `artifacts.require("HelloBlockchain")`, not `artifacts.require("./contracts/firstContract.sol")`.  In order to provide some limited compatibility with older versions of Truffle, we've made it so that using the name of the file will also sometimes work, but, as you've seen, this is not fully reliable.  I'm not familiar enough with that part of the code to know why it's hitting an error in this particular case, but the right way to solve your problem is to pass the contract name, not the file name, to `artifacts.require`.
@haltman-at Thankyou Very much for the explanation! :D

> The actual problem is that you're supplying the wrong argument to `artifacts.require`; it takes the name of the contract, not the name of the file; i.e., you should do `artifacts.require("HelloBlockchain")`, not `artifacts.require("./contracts/firstContract.sol")`. In order to provide some limited compatibility with older versions of Truffle, we've made it so that using the name of the file will also sometimes work, but, as you've seen, this is not fully reliable. I'm not familiar enough with that part of the code to know why it's hitting an error in this particular case, but the right way to solve your problem is to pass the contract name, not the file name, to `artifacts.require`.

That's resolved my problem. Thanks
Please make the contract name and file name same, it will be solve. If not knock me: [isti.ru.cse@gmail.com](mailto:isti.ru.cse@gmail.com)
